p: A parallel analysis was conducted using the MiSeq data and the analytical platform Multiplex Barcode Research And Visualization Environment (mBRAVE; http://mbrave.net/). Settings and libraries used to analyze the results from the high‐throughput sequencing can be found in Appendix S2. Results obtained from the mBRAVE platform were in the form of matches to existing data on the Barcode of Life Data System (Ratnasingham & Hebert, 2007), in the form of sequences and existing Barcode Index Numbers (Ratnasingham & Hebert, 2013). Where sequences did not match to BINs, a clustering analysis was conducted, and sequences were grouped into molecular operational taxonomic units (OTU) using a 2% sequence divergence threshold (Blaxter, 2004). All results from the mBRAVE analysis with more than 10 reads were used for discussions.
